Sentencas: BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3 (BZCYYb), a promising proton conductor of poor sinterability used in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs), has been densified in one hour at 850 C by applying direct current sintering technique (DC-sintering).
Titulo: An improved direct current sintering technique for proton conductor - BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3: The effect of direct current on sintering process

Sentencas: Under a constant electrical field, the current density through the specimen of BZCYYb rises rapidly when the temperature increases to a certain value.
Titulo: An improved direct current sintering technique for proton conductor - BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3: The effect of direct current on sintering process

Sentencas: In DC-sintering process, we restrict the current density when the sharp increase occurs.
Titulo: An improved direct current sintering technique for proton conductor - BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3: The effect of direct current on sintering process

Sentencas: By limiting current density to different values for one hour, we find that current density is the most important factor in DC-sintering process.
Titulo: An improved direct current sintering technique for proton conductor - BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3: The effect of direct current on sintering process

Sentencas: The conductivity and the grain size of BZCYYb electrolyte increase significantly with the enhanced current density, while the different initial applied electrical fields have negligible effect.
Titulo: An improved direct current sintering technique for proton conductor - BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3: The effect of direct current on sintering process

Sentencas: The stable stage of DC-sintering process can be explained by Joule heating.
Titulo: An improved direct current sintering technique for proton conductor - BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3: The effect of direct current on sintering process

Sentencas: Corresponding real temperature of specimens is estimated by applying black body radiation theory.
Titulo: An improved direct current sintering technique for proton conductor - BaZr0.1Ce0.3Y0.1Yb0.1O3: The effect of direct current on sintering process
